body: On Foot Adventure on a Shoestring, 300 West 53d Street; (212) 265-2663. title: Calendar: All Around Some Historic Towns

title: Events: Benefit Auction Of Miniature Rooms

body: EIGHTEEN years ago Isaac Erlich was a guidance counselor in the city school system in Brooklyn. He was wheeling his year-old daughter in a carriage one rainy day when he ducked for shelter into a real-estate office in Park Slope. He left it intrigued by the idea of buying a six-family house with $15,000 down and moving his family into one of the
title: Perspectives: Rentals in Brooklyn; Buying for the Long Term Back in Fashion

Monday through Saturday (open Wednesday until 9 P.M.). Free. Plants Plus Brooklyn Botanic
title: Calendar: Chairs, Plants, House Tours and Silver

body: "NEW YORK is a devil's dream, the most urbanized city in the world," Michael Gold wrote in his 1930 book "Jews Without Money," about an observation shared by boys growing up 60 years ago on the Lower East Side. "It is a mythical city buried by a volcano. No grass is found in this petrified city, no big living trees, no flowers, no bird but the drab
title: PARKS; New York's True Nature Is, Yes, Leafy

body: IT was in 1986, near the height of New York City's real estate boom, when Victoria Irwin paid $125,000 for her 400-square-foot studio in the Christadora House, a newly refurbished 17-story condominium on Avenue B in the East Village. Her eighth-floor windows were directly over Tompkins Square Park. "I knew there was some gentrification going on,
title: Prices Decline as Gentrification Ebbs

body: In a vote that could have implications for the 1993 mayoral election, Brooklyn Republicans last night elected a new county chairman with ties to a party faction that might oppose a second mayoral bid by Rudolph W. Giuliuani. Robert DiCarlo, an investment banker with close ties to Ronald S. Lauder, Mr. Giuliani's opponent in the 1989 Republican
title: Brooklyn Republicans Elect New Chairman

body: Bathed in the harsh light of a corner bodega, Joseph Durant and Bruce Weems cast a stony glance at the cars that whooshed down Classon Avenue in Brooklyn past blocks lined with abandoned buildings. Neighbors lounged on nearby stoops and children darted about the sidewalk as the two men stood in warning to the drug dealers who once swaggered on the
title: Street Patrol Gives Veterans Purpose and a Home

body: International 3-18 Steps to reduce Cuban immigration to the United States have been taken by the Bush Administration. A surge in Cuban migration this year led officials to temporarily freeze six-month tourist visas. title: Events: Day Lilies, Shakespeare and Trees

body: A private police force, as heavily armed and sometimes as violent as the drug dealers it is hired to confront, is stalking the dealers in some of Brooklyn's poorest neighborhoods, according to residents, police officers and the guards themselves. The force, licensed by the New York Secretary of State under the name SSI Patrol Services, provides
title: Security Guards Or Vigilantes?/A special report; In Brooklyn, Private Police as Violent as Their Enemy

body: FOR some, an entry level job in a restaurant may only mean serving fast food or washing dishes. For others, it may be the beginning of a lucrative and challenging career. But now a number of professionals in the food service industry are devising training programs for those who might otherwise have no prospects beyond the burgers and dirty dishes,
title: Seeing Beyond Burgers and Soapsuds

body: Shaping the City New-York Historical Society, 170 Central Park West at 77th Street; (212) 873-3400. "McKim, Mead & White's New York," an exhibition of 60 drawings and photographs of the Brooklyn Museum, the old Pennsylvania Station and other buildings designed by the firm, starts Wednesday and runs through Aug. 18. Hours: 10 A.M. to 5 P.M. Tuesday
title: Calendar: The Look Of City And Lawn

body: MOST of the 11 New York City high school students dining at L'Ecole restaurant yesterday had never eaten in a French restaurant before, and until three months ago, they had certainly never cooked a French meal. But since February, they have been part of a new program that has initiated 700 home economics students into the mysteries and
title: For 700 Students, French Cuisine 101

body: Andy Bloom and Jermaine Johnson were impressive double winners yesterday in the Joe Fox Eastern States Interscholastic championships at Columbia University's Wien Stadium. But in the 400-meter dash, Ivan Jeanmarie of Prospect Heights High School, Brooklyn, registered the performance of the day when he won in 46.7 seconds for the meet's only record.
title: Brooklyn Sprinter Sets Record in 400

body: Gardens at Dusk Brooklyn Botanic Garden, 1000 Washington Avenue, off Eastern Parkway, Prospect Heights; (718) 622-4433. A series of twilight guided tours starts today in the Osborne section of the garden, designed in the Italian style. Future tours, starting at 6:30 P.M., will be of the herb garden (May 23), the Cranford Rose Garden (May 30), the
title: Gardening Events: Twilight Walks

body: Three Brooklyn teen-agers were arrested yesterday and charged with killing a grocery store owner during an attempted holdup last week. The store owner, a popular figure in his Flatbush neighborhood, was one of five people killed in four recent robberies of all-night groceries in Brooklyn. The police said neighbors rallied to help them, providing
title: 3 Youths Held In the Slaying Of a Merchant

body: Brooklyn residents had their say last night on the creation of 51 new City Council districts, and they told the districting commission that their communities are being split up and that black and Hispanic voters are being disenfranchised to help incumbents. Residents of Park Slope, Prospect Heights, Flatbush and Crown Heights, among others, argued
title: Plan for Redistricting Is Faulted in Brooklyn

body: TENNIS France Beats Australia Fabrice Santoro, an 18-year-old newcomer to the French Davis Cup team, surprised Wally Masur in the deciding match yesterday in Nimes, France, as the French team moved into the semifinals with a 3-2 victory over Australia. (AP) Rain Halts Seles-Graf Final: Monica Seles saved two match points and forced Steffi Graf into
title: RESULTS PLUS

body: Vera Beaudin Saeedpour remembers the day when the small dark neighbor who could barely speak English came to her door, flowers in one hand, a coffeecake in the other. She had never met a Kurd before. She was a 43-year-old doctoral student at Columbia University, getting on with her education after five children and a bad marriage. Homayoun
title: About New York

body: More than 200 state troopers and New York City police officers roared thunderously yesterday in State Supreme Court in Manhattan when two drug dealers were sentenced to 40 years to life in prison for killing a state police undercover officer in a drug deal that turned into a shootout on the Lower East Side last year. "There are enough tears here to
title: Cheers Greet Sentence for Officer's Slaying

body: Dr. Vincent John Geraci, who delivered thousands of babies in more than 40 years as a family physician in Brooklyn, died on Monday at North Shore University Hospital in Manhasset, L.I. He was 76 years old and lived in Glen Cove, L.I. He died of cardiac arrest, his wife said. Dr. Geraci, a graduate of Brandeis University Medical School, maintained
title: Vincent J. Geraci, Physician, 76

body: Spring Blossoms New York Botanical Garden, 200th Street and Southern Boulevard, Bedford Park section of the Bronx; (212) 220-8777. The 25,000 tulips along the Barbara Foster Vietor Memorial Walk should be in full bloom during Tulip Weekend on Saturday and Sunday. Visitors can buy bulbs for next season as well as garden vegetable plants. There will
title: Gardening Events: Festival of Tulips

body: A man being hunted in the shooting death of former State Senator Vander L. Beatty in Brooklyn last August was arrested on Friday night in Chicago after a viewer saw his picture on the television show "America's Most Wanted" and tipped off the police, law-enforcement officials said yesterday. The wanted man was identified as Arthur Everett Flournoy,
title: TV's 'Most Wanted' Brings Arrest in Killing of Ex-Brooklyn Senator

The class, which will be held from 6:30 to 8:30 P.M., continues April 25 and May 2, 16 and 23. Fee, $90 ($75, members). Coming one-day programs include growing fruit in small spaces
title: Events: Green Thumbs And Walks Into History

body: Drifting Colors Enid A. Haupt Conservatory, New York Botanical Garden, 200th Street and Southern Boulevard, Bedford Park section of the Bronx; (212) 220-8777. title: Burgeonings: Spring Events

body: Tennis Patrick McEnroe Waits for John: Seventh-seeded Patrick McEnroe, returning first serves with well-placed passing shots, rallied from a first-set loss and reached the final of the Volvo Chicago indoor tournament yesterday with a 4-6, 6-4, 6-4 victory over Grant Connell. The final today could match brother against brother. John McEnroe played
title: RESULTS PLUS

body: Each winter, hundreds of New York City high school teachers are laid off because of a seasonal enrollment decline caused by thousands of midyear graduations and drop outs. This year, enrollment dropped as usual -- this time by about 12,000 students -- but the teachers remained on the roster, protected from layoffs by the recent agreement between
title: No-Layoff Deal Sets 500 Teachers Adrift in the System

Coffin and Florence Yoch are some designers whose work will be discussed at the symposium, on March 15 from
title: Events: Garden Design

body: The usual crowd was coming and going at Augustine's Barber Shop at 172 Park Place in the Prospect Heights section of Brooklyn on Saturday morning. The shop looks like any barbershop with its striped poles and bathing beauty calendar, but a pile of French-language newspapers and snapshots on a mirror identify it as the Haitian meeting spot it is.
title: About New York; Haitians Talk Of New Pride And Going Home

body: Although Brooklyn's rich diversity of historic and architecturally distinct housing is far too much to be explored in a day, those interested in serious sampling may want to consider a bus tour being offered next Sunday by the Brooklyn Center for the Urban Environment. The nonprofit educational group, known until last July as the Prospect Park
title: Postings: History and Housing; Touring Brooklyn by Bus

title: Garden Calendar: Bulbs And a Tree of History

body: French Class At budget-cutting time it's hard to imagine that there is money for New York City high schools to inaugurate a program in French cooking. But Richard Grausman, a cookbook author and teacher of French cooking, has worked with the home-economics departments of 12 high schools to set up such a program at no cost to the city. Last year he
title: Food Notes

body: To produce graduates who can meet the new academic standards that the City University of New York is planning to impose on its students, the city's high schools must start teaching students far better than they do now, education experts said yesterday. Only 15 New York public high schools, virtually all of them specialized academic schools or local
title: CUNY's Rules: Pressure on High Schools

title: Events: Seminars And Tours
